result.execSummary:
The defendant Neal C Conley Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Do not associate with any known users of controlled substances or those convicted of juvenile offenses. Must complete education. Must be at school every day unless defendant has a doctor's excuse. Do not be tardy, do not be disruptive in class, hallways, or on school grounds. Must complete all assignments to the best of defendant's ability.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 05-21-2018:  CFTS (to include presentence credit missing from original JOC)

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.  No absences or tardies.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Sex Offender Treatment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

State requests that DOC recommendation be followed.
Defense requests a fair sentence.

CIP and SAT eligible

BTC: 15CF219 - sent w/held - 3 yrs probation/CFTS

Defendant Neal C Conley in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Defense asks for COP and for the Court to review bond. Defense asks for exception to allow deft to go to school. The State does not object GPS remaining to allow deft to go to school as September 1

BTC: modify bond - go to school at Case High School Must go to all classes daily unless doctor's excuse, do not be disruptive in hallway or classroom and do all assignments to the best of deft's ability. Other terms and conditions remain  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.  No contact with the co-defendant, DMB.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
